tit.e: Konin-siki Code (the supplemental law determined in the Konin Era)
tit.cmt: ミススペルがありました。

sen.j: 弘仁式（こうにんしき）は、平安時代初期に編纂・施行された格式。
sen.e: The Konin-siki Code was a Kyakushiki code (amendments and enforcement regulations (of the ritsuryo)) that was compiled and enforced in the early Heian period.
The Konin-shiki was a compilation of laws that were compiled and enforced from the early Heian Period.
sen.cmt: ミススペルがありました。文書の意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: The Konin-shiki was a compilation of laws that were compiled and enforced from the early Heian Period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Totally 40 volumes.
It was a total of 40 volumes.
sen.cmt: 訳文が意味不明のためなおしました。
sen.e: It was a total of 40 volumes.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。

sen.j: 格式編纂の構想は、桓武天皇の頃から存在したが、嵯峨天皇の時代に「造格式所」を設置した。
sen.e: The idea of the compilation of the Kyakushiki codes had existed since the times of Emperor Kanmu, and in the times of Emperor Saga, 'Zokyakushiki-jo' (Kyakushiki code compilation office) was established.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「造格式所」の正式な読み方不明です。「ぞうきゃくしきじょ」は仮読みです。
sen.e: The idea of compiling the various laws had been explored since the time of Emperor Kanmu, but only began during the rein of Emperor Saga when a "Kyakushiki (law) compilation office" was established.
sen.cmt: 訳文で「造格式所」を「ぞうきゃくしきじょ」とされています。正式な読み方不明のため、そのままに残しました。意味を分かりやすくするために文書を変えました。
sen.e: The idea of compiling the various laws had been explored since the time of Emperor Kanmu, but only began during the rein of Emperor Saga when a "Kyakushiki (law) compilation office" was established.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして、藤原冬嗣を総裁として藤原葛野麻呂・秋篠安人・藤原三守・橘常主・興原敏久らと事にあたらしめてから編纂事業が本格化した。
sen.e: Then, the compilation project formally launched with designate FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu as a president, FUJIWARA no Kadonomaro, AKISHINO no Yasuhito, FUJIWARA no Mimori, TACHIBANA no Tsunenushi, and OKIHARA no Miniku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The compilation project was formally launched with FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu as a president, and responsibilities distributed between FUJIWARA no Kadonomaro, AKISHINO no Yasuhito, FUJIWARA no Mimori, TACHIBANA no Tsunenushi, and OKIHARA no Miniku.
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: The compilation project was formally launched with FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu as a president, and responsibilities distributed between FUJIWARA no Kadonomaro, AKISHINO no Yasuhito, FUJIWARA no Mimori, TACHIBANA no Tsunenushi, and OKIHARA no Miniku.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 弘仁11年4月21日 (旧暦)（820年6月5日）に弘仁格・弘仁式が同時に撰進された。
sen.e: On April 21, 820 (the old calender)(on June 5, 820 according to the solar calender), Konin-kyaku Code and Konin-shiki Code were compiled and submitted at a time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On June 5, 820, both the Konin-kyaku Code and the Konin-shiki Code were submitted.
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。訳文の日付がまちがっていました。
sen.e: On June 9, 820, both the Konin-kyaku Code and the Konin-shiki Code were submitted.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変換

sen.j: その後修訂が加えられて10年後の天長7年10月7日 (旧暦)（830年10月26日）に改めて撰進され、同年11月17日 (旧暦)（同年12月5日）に施行された。
sen.e: Then, after being corrected, they were re-compiled and re-submitted in 10 years later on October 7, 830 (the old calender)(October 26, 830 according to the solar calender) and went into effect on November 17, the same year (the old calender)(December 5, the same year according to the solar calender).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After revisions and corrections were made to it, it was resubmitted 10 years later on October 26th, 830, and put into effect on December 5th of the same year.
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: After revisions and corrections were made to it, it was resubmitted 10 years later on October 30, 830, and put into effect on December 9 of the same year.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変換

sen.j: しかし、その後完成した格式にも不備が見つかったために、更に筆削が行われ、承和 (日本)7年4月20日 (旧暦)（840年5月24日）に「改正遺漏紕繆格式」として改めて頒行が行われた。
sen.e: However, since flaws of the codes were still detected after being finished, they were again corrected and distributed as 'Kaisei iro hibyu kyakushiki ' (the revised code to correct omissions and flaws) on April 20, 840 (the old calender)(May 24, 840, according to the solar calender).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As flaws were found in the finalized edition, it was amended and the revised version was distributed on May 24th, 840 under the new title, "Kaisei Irohibyu Kyakushiki" (Revised and improved edition of the law).
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: As flaws were found in the finalized edition, it was amended and the revised version was distributed on May 28, 840 under the new title, "Kaisei Irohibyu Kyakushiki" (Revised and improved edition of the law).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変換

sen.j: 現存の弘仁格・弘仁式の条文はこの改正後のものと考えられている。
sen.e: The current provisions of the Konin-kyaku Code and Konin-shiki Code were regarded as ones from this revised code.
The existing copies of the Konin-Kyaku and Konin-Shiki are believed to be from after the final revision.
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: The existing copies of the Konin-Kyaku and Konin-Shiki are believed to be from after the final revision.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 従来、『八十一例』・『式部省例』・『民部省式』など、必要に応じて太政官及び諸官司で例もしくは式を作成していた。
sen.e: Conventionally, Daijokan (Grand Councils of the State) and each Guji (government officialas) had made regulations and codes such as "Hachijyu-hachi-rei"(the 88 regulations), "Shikibu-sho-rei"(regulations for the Ministry of Ceremonial), and "Minbu-sho-shiki" (codes for the Ministry of Popular Affairs), as necessary.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Regulations and codes were created by either the Grand or government officials and included such laws as the "Hachijyu-hachi-rei (the 88 Regulations)", the "Shikibu-sho-rei (regulations for the Ministry of Ceremonies)", and "Minbu-sho-shiki (codes for the Ministry of Popular Affairs)".
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: Regulations and codes were created by either the Grand or government officials and included such laws as the "Hachijyu-hachi-rei" (the 88 Regulations), the "Shikibu-sho-rei" (regulations for the Ministry of Ceremonies), and "Minbu-sho-shiki" (codes for the Ministry of Popular Affairs).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整

sen.j: ここにおいてこれら官司の例式や古事先例などを集めて取捨選択を行って改めて官司ごとに排列した。
sen.e: Afterward, these codes and regulations for the Guji and the precedents were collected and sorted out to be arranged by each Guji.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The codes and their precedents were gathered and chosen from, then filed by the appropriate official.
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: The codes and their precedents were gathered and chosen from, then filed by the appropriate official.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 配するのに適切な官司が無い場合には巻末に雑式として一括した。
sen.e: If there was no adequate Guji for arrangement, such codes were lumped and put in the back of the book as zoshiki (miscellaneous codes).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: If a suitable official could not be found, the document would be included in the miscellaneous section at the end of the volume.
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: If a suitable official could not be found, the document would be included in the miscellaneous section at the end of the volume.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『貞観式』制定後も同式に規定のない事項については、従来通り『弘仁式』を用いる事となっていたために混乱が生じた。
sen.e: Even "Jogan-shiki Code"was established, the "Konin-shiki Code" was still used for the matters not specified in theJogan-shiki Code and it became the cause of confusion.
Even after the "Jogan-shiki code" was established, the "Konin-shiki Code" was still referred to for matters that were not specified in the "Jogan-shiki", and it was the source of much confusion.
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: Even after the "Jogan-shiki code" was established, the "Konin-shiki Code" was still referred to for matters that were not specified in the "Jogan-shiki", and it was the source of much confusion.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: このため、改めて統一的な『延喜式』が編纂されて、以後『弘仁式』・『貞観式』は用いられなくなった。
sen.e: Then, the unified "Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers) were newly compiled and after that, "Konin-shiki Code" and "Jogan-shiki Code" were not used.
A unified "Engi-shiki" was created, and the "Konin-shiki" and "Jogan-shiki" were discarded.
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: A unified "Engi-shiki" was created, and the "Konin-shiki" and "Jogan-shiki" were discarded.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 原文は全巻亡失おり、九条家本『延喜式』（現在国宝、東京国立博物館所蔵）の紙背文書に偶々遺された。
sen.e: Original copies of the complete volume were lost and some incidentally remained as shihai monjo (an old document which was written on the other side of a piece of used paper) of the "the Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers) book belonged to the Kujo family. (presently a national treasure, owned by the Tokyo National Museum).

The original "Konin-shiki" volumes were since lost, but some of it's texts were on the back of the pages in the Kujo family's copy of the "Engi-shiki" (which was declared a national treasure and is currently stored at the Tokyo National Museum).
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: The original "Konin-shiki" volumes were since lost, but some of it's texts were on the back of the pages in the Kujo family's copy of the "Engi-shiki" (which was declared a national treasure and is currently stored at the Tokyo National Museum).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 巻十九式部省下と巻二十五主税寮上の断簡及び、諸書に見える逸文のみが知られているに過ぎない。
sen.e: Only fragments of the writing in the volume 19, the second part of the "Shikibu-sho" (the Ministry of Ceremonial), and the volume 25, the first part of the "Shuzeiryo" (Bureau of Taxation), and the quotes mentioned in some books were known.

Only fragments from the second part of the "Shikibu-sho" (the Ministry of Ceremonial) in Volume 19, and the first part of the "Shuzeiryo" (Bureau of Taxation) in volume 25 remain, along with quotations mentioned in various books.
sen.cmt: 意味を分かりやすくするために変えました。
sen.e: Only fragments from the second part of the "Shikibu-sho" (the Ministry of Ceremonial) in Volume 19, and the first part of the "Shuzeiryo" (Bureau of Taxation) in volume 25 remain, along with quotations mentioned in various books.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、30巻本写本と称するものが存在するが、これは偽書である。
sen.e: There is a book referred to as a transcription of the volume 30, however, this is a forged book.
There is a 30 volume set that claims to be a copy of the original, but which is actually a fake.
